bibl.title: The Greek Origins of the Romans and the Roman Origins of Homer in the Homeric Scholia and in POxy. 3710. English Translation by Justin Rainey.
bibl.note: 1. The Greek origins of the Romans and Latin as an Aeolian dialect. - 2. Greeks and Romans in the scholia to the Iliad and the Odyssey. - 3. P. Oxy. LIII, 3710 (= M.-P.3 1212.01; LDAB 1690). - Conclusions.

bibl.title: From Scholars to Scholia. Chapters in the History of Ancient Greek Scholarship.

bibl.seg: Ascheri Paola, The Greek Origins of the Romans and the Roman Origins of Homer in the Homeric Scholia and in POxy. 3710. English Translation by Justin Rainey.

Franco Montanari and Lara Pagani (Edd.), From Scholars to Scholia. Chapters in the History of Ancient Greek Scholarship = Trends in Classics. Supplementary Volumes. 9 (Berlin - New York, 2011) pp. 65-86.

1. The Greek origins of the Romans and Latin as an Aeolian dialect. - 2. Greeks and Romans in the scholia to the Iliad and the Odyssey. - 3. P. Oxy. LIII, 3710 (= M.-P.3 1212.01; LDAB 1690). - Conclusions.
